description.narrative: Green Energy SME Development Project. The project’s strategic objective is to facilitate the transformation of Tajikistan’s energy sector, in particular the emergence of independent energy entrepreneurs

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: Component1 - LoA is agreed and signed with the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources - Inter-Ministerial Working Group on renewable energy and energy efficiency (RES/EE) is established - at least 2 priority by-laws are identified, and 1 sub-law is developed - concept for the development of the energy sector is developed - Program Development of the energy sector is developed - Program Development of renewable energy sources for 2021-2025 is prepared Component 2 - A call for proposal is organized to select 5 financial partners based on open and transparent tender procedures - Green loan products are developed and introduced by selected MFIs with a particular emphasis on ensuring and promoting equal access to such products for women and women-headed SMEs. At least 100 loans are provided to the population (in 2020) and 500 loans are provided at the end of this subproject component - training program developed and delivered to the selected MFIs. Monitoring tools for tracking performance of green loans introduced - 4,000 (2,500 women) beneficiaries use RE as a result of this subproject component Component 3 - Based on the outcome of the Feasibility Study, bidding procedures for installation of at least 350kW solar generation capacity in Murgab, GBAO are initiated - As a result of this subproject component, at least 2,000 people (60% women) gain improved access to energy Component 4 - Project mid-term review is conducted

Component 1 - LoA was agreed and signed with MEWR on October 16, 2021. WIthin this LoA MEWR agreed to: • Develop and approve a concept for the development of the energy sector; • Develop a list of by-laws to the current laws in the field of energy, including the Law of the Republic of Tajikistan On Energy dated November 29, 2000, On Renewable Energy Sources dated November 23, 2015, On Energy Saving and Energy Efficiency dated September 19, 2013. At least 3 regulatory legal acts on RES / EE have been developed; • Development of explanatory materials on energy conservation, energy efficiency and the development of renewable energy sources. - IMWG is established, first meeting of IMWG will be held on December 9th, 2021 Component 2 - Frankfurt School of Finance & Management was selected to conduct a feasibility study on identifying the demand for solar powered technology among SMEs, and provide cost-benefit analysis of at least two green loan products that are financially feasible and attractive to the end user. The contract with the consulting firm is ongoing, with the new expiration date being February 28, 2022. Per their deliverables the company is to: - identify MFIs that are able and are willing to partner with the project, interested in GE financing and have capacity to do so should the project announce a call for proposals to select minimum of 3 MFIs; - conduct analysis of supply side: vendors offering solar technology - conduct analysis of demand side with focus on tourism and SMEs, individuals and households; - develop a pipeline of loans during 2021 and 2022 - prepare recommendation on the feasible amount of loans disbursed - develop 2 tailored green loan products with selected MFIs including m&e framework - develop a marketing plan for promotion of solar technologies and related loan products Based on the outcomes of the conducted feasibility study and market analysis, then the plan to engage with MFIs through a call for proposals will be elaborated and quantity of green loans determined. It is clear as of now, that without safeguarding the supply of technology supply, we cannot achieve the target of 2,000 GE loans set forth. Component 3 - project has gone through an MTR and the implementation strategy was adapted to focus the efforts of Component 3. MTR had 12 recommendations and in recommendation 8 it stated: Drop the focus on SME RESCOs and pilots and to exclude RESCO-related activities from the revised AWP and revised budget. Project Management has identified an alternative activity in order to achieve the targets of this specific component. World Bank in partnership with MEWR and Pamir Energy is implementing a Tajikistan Rural Electrification Project and this project will provide electricity coverage to the off-grid regions of GBAO. UNDP is to partner with the aforementioned entities to channel funds for this component to finance works related to: screening potential projects, conducting pre-feasibility and feasibility studies, preparation of tender documents, construction supervision. All four parties are coming to a final agreement on terms and modality of the collaboration. MEWR has provided a letter of support to the Project confirming their interest and commitment to ensure successful completion of works in this regard. Negotiations in finalizing the Statement of Interest between the four interested parties are ongoing. Project funded feasibility study of building a solar-power station in Alichur district in Murghab was completed in June of 2021 and shared with MEWR and Pamir Energy for considerations in their efforts to provide electricity for Alichur. Component 4 - MTR was conducted and finalized in May 2021, with giving the project overall rating as moderately unsatisfactory, and gave 12 specific recommendations to follow in order to achieve concrete results for the project. - Project has co-financed an annual conference organized by Association of Micro-Finance Organizations of Tajikistan on «Financial inclusion as a driver of investments and sustainable development of Tajikistan. Current trends, challenges, and opportunities» that took place on December 2 and 3rd, 2021. GE Project Manager presented information about the project specifically on green financing during their work group and had the opportunity to build a good basis among the tourist SME community for future collaboration in loan disbursement phase of the project in 2022.

Component 1 - Technical support provided to the national stakeholders in the development of the drafts of by-laws - A detailed policy and regulatory gap analysis of the country conducted and a roadmap to identify priority policy and regulation measures on RES and EE developed and submitted to key stakeholders; - Stakeholder consultations (public and private) on priority policy and regulatory documents undertaken; - With support of CTA and financial advisor provide technical support to the national stakeholders in the development of package of fiscal, custom and other incentives related to the production and import of GE technologies: - Conduct preparatory activities related to overview of establishment of EE/RE Fund; - Technical support to the national stakeholders to review relevant international standards for PV and SWH - Draft of the roadmap developed based on the selected the most appropriate standards for Tajikistan Component 2 - Conducting of comprehensive GE country market assessment - Design and development of green financials products related to SWH and EE/RE Component 3 - Conducting feasibility study for identification of actual demand for electricity in various parts of Murgab district

Component 1 • LoA is agreed and signed with the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources • Inter-Ministerial Working group (IMWG) on renewable energy and energy efficiency (RES/EE) is established • At least 4 priority by-laws are identified, and 2 sub-laws are developed • Technical support to the national stakeholders to review relevant international standards for PV and SWH • Draft of the roadmap developed based on the selected most appropriate standards for Tajikistan Component 2 • A call for proposal is organized to select 5 financial partners based on open and transparent tender procedures • Green loan products are developed and introduced by selected MFIs with a particular emphasis on ensuring and promoting equal access to such products for women and women-headed SMEs. At least 100 loans are provided to the population (in 2020) and 500 loans are provided at the end of this subproject component • Training program developed and delivered to the selected MFIs. Monitoring tools for tracking performance of green loans introduced • 4,000 (2,500 women) beneficiaries use RE as a result of this subproject component Component 3 • Based on the outcome of the Feasibility Study, bidding procedures for installation of at least 350 kW solar generation capacity in Murgab, GBAO are initiated • As a result of this subproject component, at least 4,000 people (60% women) gain improved access to energy • 10 representatives from the government, NGOs and private sector participate in the study tour on best solar technologies practices in Zagreb, Croatia • 100 one-pagers with infographics on subproject “Affordable business environment amongst rural Women in 10 pilot villages of Tajikistan” (funded by OFID) are produced and disseminated. A short documentary on the same subproject is prepared and broadcasted on the local media. • As a result of the subproject “Mobile Energy Bus”, as well as other PR activities (including by means of www.neruisabz.tj), at least 1,000,000 people (60% women) are accessed by marketing and awareness raising campaign

The project has been impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak in 2020. Within component 1 of the project, the LoA with the Ministry of Energy and subsequent legislative work was postponed. The same goes for Component 2 (microfinancing). MFIs switched to the ‘work from home’ modality and it was considered unreasonable to proceed with this component as its implementation by MFIs would require a wide marketing campaign including face-to-face communication with the rural population given the insufficient level of demand for RES technologies in the country (as revealed by similar projects financed by EBRD and ADB). Within Component 3, the feasibility study for installation of a solar generating capacity in Alichur was delayed. It is expected to be completed before end of 2020 and the actual construction works are planned for 2021. Moreover, a local company (Green Technologies) was contracted for “Conducting an awareness raising / marketing campaign by “Mobile Energy Vehicle” in the Republic of Tajikistan” in March and, despite the COVID-19 complexities, the contractor was able to implement their contract and is expected to complete all tasks before end of 2020.

Component 1. 1.1. Inter-Ministerial Working group (IMWG) on renewable energy and energy efficiency (RES/EE) is established. 1.2. At least 2 priority by-laws are identified, and 1 sub-law is developed. 1.3. Concept for the development of the energy sector is developed. 1.4. A draft of the Program Development of renewable energy sources for 2022-2030 is prepared. 1.5. List of bylaws or other regulatory acts, providing financial incentives and support mechanisms for green energy investment developed. 1.6. At least 20 officials participating in IMWG meetings. 1.7. Subject to travel availability (due to COVID-19) either: (i) Participation of up to 5 members of IMWG in Intersolar, the worlds leading exhibition and conference for the Solar Industry in Munich, Germany, May 11-13, 2022; or (ii) participation of up to 2 members of IMWG in the 27th Conference of Parties (CoP-27) under the UNFCCC (Nov 7-18th, 2022); or (iii) organization of a study tour to Croatia initially scheduled for 2020. 1.8. International quality standards for PV and SWH equipment reviewed and most applicable and relevant for Tajikistan identified. Component 2. 2.1. Up to 3 MFIs selected for cooperation in GE financing. 2.2. At least one Green loan product developed and introduced by selected MFIs with a particular emphasis on ensuring and promoting equal access to such products for women and women-headed SMEs. 2.3. Marketing campaign for green loan products designed and implemented. 2.4. At least 10 technicians from different regions of Tajikistan are trained in installation and maintenance of GE (PV, SWH) technologies. 2.5. At least 100 loans are disbursed; at least 300 loans approved. Disbursement of GE loans is monitored regularly. 2.6. 2 NGOs to promote SWH systems in GBAO and Zarafshan valley, selected. 2.7. 1,000 (600 women) beneficiaries use RE as a result of this component. Component 3. 3.1. LoA with the MoEWR signed. 3.2. ТА provided to the MoEWR to initiate projects to be implemented under WB-funded TREP project. 3.3. Financing scheme for financing of SWH systems in tourism facilities developed. 3.4. ТА provided to tourism facilities in preparing list of technical specifications and loan applications. 3.5. At least 10 projects initiated. 3.6. 2,000 (including owners of tourism facilities, as well as tourists). 3.7. 1,000,000 (through the implemented MARCs including under Component. Component 4. 4.1. Results of project shared with all key stakeholders.
